TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintPreviewControl extends System.Windows.Forms.Control

Docs.summary: Represents the raw preview part of print previewing from a Windows Forms application, without any dialog boxes or buttons. Most objects are found on objects, but they do not have to be.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview. If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.UseAntiAlias%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>. To run this example, place the following code in a form and call the `InitializePrintPreviewControl` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample/VB/form1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> class, the following read/write properties are initialized.
|Property|Default Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Columns%2A>|1| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Rows%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPage%2A>|0|
You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.

To run this example, place the following code in a form and call the `InitializePrintPreviewControl` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnResize(class System.EventArgs eventargs) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.OnResize%2A> method resizes the page in proportion to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> control. If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> centers the page on the control.

Protected Overridable Sub OnStartPageChanged (e As EventArgs)
abstract member OnStartPageChanged : EventArgs -> unit override this.OnStartPageChanged : EventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.OnStartPageChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event StartPageChanged As EventHandler

Docs.summary: Occurs when the start page changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPageChanged> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> named `PrintPreviewControl1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPageChanged> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#654](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#654)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#654](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#654)]

## Remarks Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.
